item.title: A multi-robot-multi-task scheduling system for autonomous chemistry laboratories
item.description:
Junyi Zhou, Man Luo, Linjiang Chen, Qing Zhu, Shan Jiang, Fei Zhang, Weiwei Shang, Jun Jiang, Digital Discovery. None(None)] 2024. https://openalex.org/W4406371854
We present a multi-robot-multi-task scheduling system designed for autonomous chemistry laboratories to enhance the efficiency of executing complex chemical experiments. Building on the herein formulated and developed scheduling algorithms and...
item.author: Junyi Zhou, Man Luo, Linjiang Chen, Qing Zhu, Shan Jiang, Fei Zhang, Weiwei Shang, Jun Jiang

item.title: Balancing Molecular Information and Empirical Data in the Prediction of Physico-Chemical Properties
item.description:
Johannes Zenn, Dominik Gond, Fabian Jirasek, Robert Bamler, Digital Discovery. None(None)] 2024. https://openalex.org/W4406396123
Predicting the physico-chemical properties of pure substances and mixtures is a central task in thermodynamics. Established prediction methods range from fully physics-based ab-initio calculations, which are only feasible for very...
item.author: Johannes Zenn, Dominik Gond, Fabian Jirasek, Robert Bamler

item.title: Composition and structure analyzer/featurizer for explainable machine-learning models to predict solid state structures
item.description:
Emil I. Jaffal, Sangjoon Lee, Danila Shiryaev, Alex Vtorov, Nikhil K. Barua, Holger Kleinke, Anton O. Oliynyk, Digital Discovery. None(None)] 2024. https://openalex.org/W4406525604
Traditional and non-classical machine learning models for solid-state structure prediction have predominantly relied on compositional features (derived from properties of constituent elements) to predict the existence of structure and its...
item.author: Emil I. Jaffal, Sangjoon Lee, Danila Shiryaev, Alex Vtorov, Nikhil K. Barua, Holger Kleinke, Anton O. Oliynyk
